1 tablet (2.5 mg) by mouth once daily
1 tablet (25 mg) by mouth once daily
1 tablet (40 mg) by mouth once daily
1 tablet (20 mg) by mouth once daily

Alendronic acid (as alendronate sodium) 10 mg oral tablet
1 tablet (10 mg) by mouth once daily
Clopidogrel (as clopidogrel bisulfate) 75 mg oral tablet
400 micrograms per spray, use 1 spray under the tongue as needed for chest pain, may repeat every 5 minutes as needed, up to 3 sprays in 15 minutes
Metoprolol tartrate (as metoprolol succinate) 100 mg prolonged-release oral tablet
1 tablet (81 mg) by mouth once daily
Atorvastatin (as atorvastatin calcium) 20 mg oral tablet
1 tablet (20 mg) by mouth once daily
Prasugrel (as prasugrel hydrochloride) 10 mg oral tablet
Metoprolol tartrate (as metoprolol succinate) 50 mg prolonged-release oral tablet
1 tablet (100 mg) by mouth once daily
Influenza virus antigen only vaccine product
Clostridium tetani toxoid antigen adsorbed only vaccine product
Development of individualized plan of care
Assessment of health and social care needs
Depression screening using Patient Health Questionnaire Two-Item score (procedure)

ul.li: Patient will monitor and record weight daily to detect early signs of fluid retention.
Patient will limit sodium intake to less than 2 grams per day.
Patient will restrict daily fluid intake as recommended.
Patient will take all heart failure medications as prescribed without missing doses.
Patient will recognize and promptly report symptoms such as increased shortness of breath, swelling, or rapid weight gain.
Achieve LDL cholesterol less than 1.8 mmol/L for secondary prevention of atherosclerotic cardiovascular disease
Achieve non-HDL cholesterol less than 2.6 mmol/L
Achieve fasting triglycerides less than 1.7 mmol/L
Achieve weight loss to reduce severity of obstructive sleep apnea.
Reduce AHI to less than 15 events per hour.
Use CPAP device for at least 4 hours per night on 70% of nights.
Maintain minimum nocturnal oxygen saturation above 90%.
Patient will implement recommended lifestyle changes to achieve and maintain target blood pressure.
Patient will achieve and maintain target HbA1c through diabetes self-management strategies.
Patient will achieve and maintain fasting blood glucose within target range through diabetes self-management strategies.
Patient will achieve and maintain target body weight as part of diabetes self-management.
